page.title: 07HOUSES IN WATCHET
page.content: The oldest houses in Watchet are situated near the harbour, where the town first sprang up. Development spread South and East, where gradually modern building styles have evolved. Terraced houses form the majority, although there are many semi-detached. A minority is detached. Few houses are thatched; most have tiles or slate roofs. Chimneys vary in size and decoration and the newest houses have none. Many older buildings have three storeys. Modern buildings include two storey houses, bungalows, and purpose-built flats. Many buildings are necessarily on a gradient. They are built chiefly of stone or brick, sometimes with external rendering. Doors are often painted in different colours, and windows sometimes double-glazed. Most houses have a small front, and larger back gardens.
